intro: Humboldtia unijuga, commonly known as the single-seed orchid, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive single seed pod, which is a rare trait among orchids. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Humboldtia unijuga is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of Socotra, showcasing specialized features for survival in such conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
